result.execSummary:
The defendant Rigoberto M Rodriguez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Probation may be terminated early if deemed appropriate by the agent.

miscConds.notes: Pay all court costs and supervision fees.  $200 DNA surcharge assessed.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
Seach for employment. Obtain and maintain full-time employment OR attend school full-time, may be a combination of both to equal 40 hours per week.

Alcohol assessment and follow through with recommendations. No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Defendant may not have any alcohol in or on the premises of home.  Defendant may not go into any establishments that sell alcohol except for restaurants and grocery stores.
Drug assessment and follow through with recommendations. No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.   Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.
Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent, including an AODA assessment and treatment. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Rigoberto M Rodriguez

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: DOC-notice of court ordered financial obligations status - balance due on court ordered financial obligations $216.00.  Defendant due to discharge 06-15-2016.
records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: I AM UNDECIDED ABOUT SEEKING POSTCONVICTION RELIEF AND I KNOW I NEED TO DECIDE AND TELL MY LAWYER WITHIN 20 DAYS.
Status conference on June 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on May 21, 2015 at 03:15 pm.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:   It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Rigoberto M Rodriguez in court.  Thomas Jerome Coaty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Mark Garvin.   Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, p-ng, bond set.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 21, 2015 at 03:15 pm.  Status conference scheduled for June 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Initial appearance on April 22, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
def. posted.  New OI date given.
